sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Compare</radical> a <radical>building</radical> to some <radical>dirt</radical> and you'll see the difference between you and His and Her <kanji>Highness</kanji>. You live outside and sleep on the dirt. But His and Her Highness both live in a huge building.
meaningInfo: Picture Her Highness, high up in her building. Now compare her home and life to yours, you dirt person.
readingMnemonic: I bet His <kanji>Highness</kanji> has never had to sleep in <reading>hay</reading> (<ja>へい</ja>) either, like you do every night. Hay is what you use as a pillow, mattress, blanket. Basically hay and dirt are all you have. Unlike His Highness.
readingInfo: Picture His and Her Highness coming out of their huge building and walking by you in your hay pile. "My goodness, Highness, have you ever seen such a dirty, fluffy creature?" "My no, dear, let's move quickly to remove it from our sight!"
